publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3480 Cathie Craigie: OKI (UK) Limited Job Losses—That the Parliament notes with concern the announcement by OKI (UK) Limited that 40 people on permanent contracts are to be made redundant at its manufacturing facility in Cumbernauld; regrets that this measure is a direct result of the current economic downturn, and calls on the Scottish Executive to work with all other public agencies to ensure that every assistance is offered to the workforce and their families at this difficult time. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn*, Patricia Ferguson*, Mary Mulligan*, Margaret Curran*, John Park*, David Stewart*
S3M-3480 OKI (UK) Limited Job Losses (lodged on 19 February 2009) Hugh O’Donnell*, Ken Macintosh*
S3M-3480 OKI (UK) Limited Job Losses (lodged on 19 February 2009) Gil Paterson*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3480 OKI (UK) Limited Job Losses (lodged on 19 February 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-3480 OKI (UK) Limited Job Losses (lodged on 19 February 2009) Rhoda Grant*, Jackie Baillie*
S3M-3480 OKI (UK) Limited Job Losses (lodged on 19 February 2009) Karen Whitefield*
